title: Building Research Capacity in Empirical Socio-Legal Research
abstractText:
This project draws together researchers and academics from 6 universities - including Manchester, Sheffield, Loughborough, Nottingham Trent, Bradford and Leeds - to deliver a series of workshops aimed at encouraging and sustaining capacity in empirical socio-legal research (ESLR). It aims to: 

  • augment existing doctoral training, support doctoral researchers and improve the quality of doctoral training and supervision in the field of ESLR;
  • improve support for doctoral supervisors;
  • develop effective mentoring for mid career researchers in ESLR;
  • encourage the mainstreaming of the outputs of ESLR into curricula at undergraduate and postgraduate level (as the basis of encouraging 'feeder-routes' and a new generation of researchers);
  • build a community of ESLR scholars based on a networking approach as the basis for sustainable capacity-building;
  • increase the take-up of existing specialised ESRC research training schemes amongst this community.
In view of the identified needs for capacity-building in the field of socio-legal research, the project activities are aimed at four broad groups: (1) doctoral researchers engaged in socio-legal projects with an empirical element; (2) early career researchers in HE; (3) mid-career 'switchers' who have an established position and wish to enhance their skills in ESLR (supervisors, mentors and independent researchers); and (4) researchers employed outside of the academic sector in private and NGO organisations.
